name: 02-Data Preparation
content:
Data Profiling and Preparation

Data Description and Preparation

  • Data Description:
  • The dataset includes both continuous (e.g., available money, credit limit, authorization amount) and categorical (e.g., account ID, fraud label) variables. Example fields:
  • ACCT_AVL_MONEY_BEFORE_AMT – Available money before transaction.
  • ACCT_CL_AMT – Assigned credit limit.
  • ACCT_CURR_BAL – Current balance.
  • AUTHZN_AMT – Authorized transaction amount.
  • FRAUD_LABEL – Binary indicator (0 = genuine, 1 = fraud).

Data Preparation:

Handling missing values and negative balances (e.g., acct_curr_bal had min value = -863.5)

Feature scaling and normalization for continuous variables.

Encoding categorical values for model input.

Derived features – ratios such as utilization (curr_bal/credit_limit), frequency of high-value transactions, etc.

Feature Engineering

Steps Performed:

  • Cleaned missing and invalid values.
  • Normalized continuous variables (balances, credit limits, transaction amounts).
  • Encoded categorical values (fraud labels).
  • Derived features:
  • Utilization Ratio: acct_curr_bal / acct_cl_amt.
  • High-Value Transaction Flag: Transactions above dynamic thresholds.
  • Frequency Features: Number of transactions per account in defined time windows.
  • Outcome: Ready-to-train dataset with enriched features for detecting fraud patterns.
